definition: disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence

sentences.english: Christians celebrate the resurrection of Christ from the death.
sentences.chinese: 基督教徒們慶祝耶穌基督的復活。

sentences.english: Christians preponderate in the population of that part of the country.
sentences.chinese: 基督教徒在該國的那一地區的人口中居多。

sentences.english: Baptism is a water purification ritual practiced by all Christians.
sentences.chinese: 洗禮是所有基督教徒都要經歷的浸水淨身儀式。

sentences.english: But early Christians accepted all these books.
sentences.chinese: 但是早期的基督教徒接受這些書。

sentences.english: When my mom was seventy-six years old, she became a Christ.
sentences.chinese: 當母親76歲時，她成爲一名基督教徒。

sentences.english: Christians in India make up just over 2 percent of its one billion population. (AP Photo/Saurabh Das)
sentences.chinese: 印度有十億人口，但基督教徒僅佔2%多一點。

sentences.english: you know how Christians squabble all the time.
sentences.chinese: 因爲基督教徒經常爭吵。

sentences.english: So,Christians again seem to have divided up.
sentences.chinese: 因此基督教徒似乎又在此劃分開來。

sentences.english: There are examples of Christians who do not believe in a future life.
sentences.chinese: 而且世上也有許多基督教徒並不相信未來生活。

sentences.english: Christians preponderate in the population of that part of the country.
sentences.chinese: 基督教徒在該國那一地區的人口中居多。

sentences.english: The fourth chapter introduced the non-follower to Christian's approval degree.
sentences.chinese: 第四章介紹了非信徒對基督教徒的認同程度。

sentences.english: God is the only One who can make a true Christian.
sentences.chinese: 上帝是唯一能夠成就真正的基督教徒的人。

sentences.english: Christians believe Jesus redeems them from their sins.
sentences.chinese: 基督教徒堅信耶穌能將他們從自己的罪惡中救贖。

sentences.english: Early Christians thought marriage was inescapably tainted by the presence of sex.
sentences.chinese: 早期基督教徒認爲，婚姻受到性愛的污染。

sentences.english: Pyongyang was the center of Christian activity before the Korean War.
sentences.chinese: 在朝鮮戰爭前，平壤是基督教徒的活動中心。
所以基督教徒經常爭吵。

definition: religious belief/to practice a faith/to be religious
